summary:
I’m Zander (https://blog.xargs.io/page/me/).

Polyglot, problem solver, remote-worker, and engineering leader. I enjoy solving problems using the right tools for the job (according to technical capability, ecosystem support, and team composition). I have solved problems in production with various languages and platforms. I’ve been the CTO of a 50 person startup, a Sr. Director of Engineering, and most recently leading a deeply technical backend group.

I’m currently excited and interested in working with:

Golang
Databases at scale (Postgresql, MongoDB, MySQL)
Log Architecture and Data pipelines
Elixir/OTP/Phoenix
Clojure (as long as there’s clojure/spec involved)
Distributed & Fault Tolerant Systems

Note: I rarely reply on LinkedIn to messages or posts. Please include the phrase orange-platypus in your subject line so I can filter it to avoid spam box.
headline: Architecture Lead

position.title: Architecture Lead for Platform
position.description:
Software Architecture Lead for Platform Org.

Deployed like a software pitbull on a leash to go tackle our tough problems.

position.title: Experienced Database Reliability Engineer
position.description:
Like all good startups, I've pivoted to a more leveraged domain... this time taking the steering wheel of my terminal in both hands and plotting a course into the realm of experienced software engineering on the same team I founded as a Group Manager, then as a TLM, and now as a senior and if I do say so, distinguished member of the team as an IC.

The best summary I can provide is: I'm holding the career ladder upside down and it's intentional. Despite getting into software engineering in order to wrangle Google Sheets, write status reports, file TPS reports, and conjure Jira tickets... I'm taking my career a shiny new direction and hanging up my human ETL skillset for a black and green terminal and b-trees.

I'll continue to lead our team on rolling our our next generation storage platform at 300% the speed of comparables and doing little side quests that maximize shareholder value.

This year we revolutionize SQL at Plaid, next year it's NoSQL or caching and finding my next professional raiding crew! We have a number of great high value challenges here at Plaid and it's been great working with this team to deliver.

position.title: Technical Lead Manager
position.description:
After serving three consecutive sentences as a Sr Engineering leader, I've been granted a reprieve to trade in my google sheets and gmail endorsements for the honor, excitement and obsession of leading our Online Storage team.

While taking this working sabbatical from being a Manager of Managers, I'm resting on my laurels by working hard with a small and mighty team to solve all our online storage needs across engineering using two weird tricks. 

I'm enjoying LARPing as a software engineer with 75% of my time and experiencing the thrill of carrying a pager, the excitement of deploying code on Fridays, and the zest for life that only comes from living on the edge of sanity.

We're doing great things in Online Storage and very proud of my teams leveraged impact throughout the organization. Anywhere where you're OLTP'ing, KV'ing, NOSQL'ing, we'll be there at your side, like the scene in Ghost, consulting on your migrations and your connection configurations for obscure drivers and automating away your headaches.

position.title: Manager of Managers (Director)
position.description:
Area Manager of Platform Group (~25)

Responsibilities include managing managers, performance management, group level strategic vision and execution.

I'm leveraging my technical leadership, recruiting skill and ability to grow talent to horizontally scale our group in order to keep up with the amazing growth of fintech.

This role will test my ability to deliver manager of managers level expertise in Google Calender, Google Docs, and Google Sheets.

position.title: Engineering Manager
position.description:
Manager of Data Modeling Team in Platform layer of organization.

Guided team through large data migrations, scaling and reliability on a large database cluster, and mentored peer managers.

Gained massive expertise in Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Calendar and MongoDB and was promoted for my prowess in these technologies EOY 2021. Lesser specialization occurred with Golang, GRPC, Microservices, Kubernetes, and Gantt Charts.

position.title: Senior Director of Software Engineering
position.description:
Guided both backend and frontend engineers during my time in leadership at Axios.

While there we launched a site revamp, a mobile app with new backend, and Axios HQ. 

My terminal role in company involved working closely with Axios founder in building out the Axios HQ SaaS product while guiding a cross functional team. I leveraged my combination of technology and product experience to help shape the roadmap and guided the project to initial release.

position.title: Director of Software Engineering
position.description:
Hired and managed a talented team of software engineers building out an amazing on-demand ecommerce manufacturing startup.

Built out team, designed 1-2 year strategies, and contributed to company roadmap as part of the Executive team.

When I needed to relax off hours, I built out CI/CD, AWS IAM security rules, secure password storage systems (AWS Secrets Manager + AWS Vault + STS), infrastructure as code (EC2, IAM, etc), Kubernetes, staging environments, developer environment tooling (developer efficiency projects), business intelligence tooling using a open source project I wrote to stream data from MongoDB into PostgreSQL in order to perform critical business reporting.

The most technically nuanced project that I contributed architectural guidance and execution was moving our stack off of MongoDB in order to unlock urgent and important product development. We succeeded :). I provided my expertise in NoSQL and SQL systems through performance debugging and coordinating SQL training for team from our amazing Lead Product Manager.
